programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: When Mels pretzel is eaten by a pigeon, Barney creates a high-seas adventure to find another, but it goes awry when Captain Mel doesnt listen to her crew. Mel realizes its important to listen to others when youre working as a team.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When a group of alley dogs, aided by a heroic stray, are saved from Catwoman by kind-hearted Buff, he brings them all back to live in the Batcave, unbeknownst to the rest of the Bat-Family.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Jestah injures herself preparing for an extreme sports competition with the other Zoomers, Bibi helps her overcome her fear of going to the mechanic so she can heal up in time to compete.

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gangs trip to be bayou is ruined by a shambling Swamp Beast thats scaring away anyone who dares to enter its soggy domain!

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang hits the ski slopes although Daphnes more focused on nailing Fred with a revenge snowball. Their snowy fun is soon interrupted by the appearance of an evil Snowman Monster eager to scare all trespassers off his mountain.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: A crafty cat burglar is causing alarm and concern throughout the town with a series of daring rooftop robberies. After Mrs Wickets house is burgled and Bean has his wallet stolen he decides the only way to deal with this cunning housebreaker is to don a costume and become a superhero (like the ones in his favourite comic book). But Super Bean soon finds he has his hands full helping to rescue cats stuck in trees and old ladies with their spilled shopping.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is tidying his flat and chucking out a load of old unwanted junk. Unfortunately during the big clear out Teddy accidentally falls into a bin bag which gets put out in the street. Bean is horrified when the rubbish van arrives and he realises that dear old Teddy is now on his way to the landfill. Bean races across town to the dump but how will he ever find his friend amongst all the mountains of junk?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is feeling very left out when he discovers that Mrs Wicket is having a huge party downstairs and apparently he isnt invited. Bean tries every trick in the book to sneak himself into the party - even resorting to hiding inside an enormous cake. If only he knew the real reason for the celebration.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is shocked when Teddy receives a birthday card from Beans girlfriend, Irma Gobb. The bears Birthday had completely slipped his mind. And what do you get for the teddy that has everything? A morning in a toy shop, burgers for lunch and a slap up tea party, of course. (But only if you can afford it.)

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans landlady is hopping mad on finding molehills on her lovely croquet lawn. Bean looks to get hammered if he does not rid the old lady of the cuddly little half-blind culprit. He fails dismally with his eccentric mole extermination methods and ends up simply taking the pesky rodent for a ride.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs finally catch Lamput! Mission accomplished…and now they have nothing to do. Every other job to catch lab experiments gone rogue is a piece of cake compared to Lamput. Realizing that theyve lost their lives purpose, Specs and Skinny decide to break Lamput out of the labs hi-tech prison so that they can go back to catching him again.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: After the Docs constantly fail to catch Lamput with the power of science and technology, they come across an unlikely source to help them with their troubles - Magic! A witch offers them a magic marker that gives them any supernatural powers they draw on their skin. Lamput must now escape and Skinny with their new magical power!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput takes refuge in a fancy hotel. Specs and Skinny bluff their way past the doorman by acting like they come from the expensive side of the tracks. Spoiler: they dont. The honeymoon suite is like nothing theyve ever seen; the Docs sheen of respectability quickly evaporates when theres robes to wear and beds to jump on. Their taste of the good life doesnt last long, though; another Lamput chase results in a proper trashed hotel room, just like you read about. Then downstairs for some à la carte chaos in the hotel restaurant. Its bad news for the Docs when the tab comes due; a Lab wage wont cover these extras.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over the last spoonful of Yummy. Their brawl is interrupted when they happen upon a full crate of chocolate spread in the garage. The rodents snatch the crate and take off on a drone. The bear catches up with them, mounted on the back of a giant bat, but the cargo falls onto the roof of a sacred Mayan temple thats boobytrapped! When they recover the Yummy, Grizzy and the Lemmings are pursued by a stone giant!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Night has fallen over the jungle and the solar panels do not generate enough electricity to charge Grizzys TV. When he surprises the Lemmings playing with fireflies that could make his panels work, he catapults the rodents into the distance. The rodents land on a Mayan temple where they discover a magic tiara that can control fireflies. Grizzy, lacking electricity, wants to get the tiara for himself.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: After stealing Grizzys jar of Yummy chocolate spread, the Lemmings propel the bear far from the log cabin. Grizzy lands in a temple where he finds a crystal skull which gives you the power to sow discord within a group. Grizzy uses it to set the rodents at odds amongst themselves and takes advantage of the general fight to recover the chocolate spread. But the effects of the magic skull only last a certain time and the ill-feelings cease. The Lemmings unite to give Grizzy a taste of his own medicine!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: While climbing back to the cabin carrying a load of delicious berries, Grizzy trips and falls over backwards. He performs a series of acrobatics worthy of a diving champ and resurfaces safe and sound despite himself. The Lemmings, who saw everything, are in awe and treat Grizzy like an idol. Grizzy starts to enjoy this VIP treatment until the Lemmings ask him to repeat his exploit. Grizzy agrees but discovers that the Lemmings have built a giant diving board for the occasion.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings lose their jar of chocolate spread in a labyrinthian Temple. Determined to recover their favorite afternoon snack, they confront one another in the maze, but end up getting totally lost. Grizzy finds himself back at square one and decides to find something to make holes in the walls and cheat. As for the Lemmings, they discover a magic map of the place that enables you to orient yourself and modify the corridors in real time. Which cheater will win?

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Things start to disappear from the log cabin as if by magic. Grizzy is persuaded that the Lemmings are the culprits, but the Lemmings are also victims of inexplicable thefts. As they argue, Grizzy and the Lemmings discover the true authors of the repeated thefts: a gang of fanatic partridges who bring stolen objects as offerings to their goddess, a giant partridge. Grizzy and Lemmings join forces to infiltrate the nest and recover their belongings.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Butch tricks Tom into switching places with him and sends Tom off to live the life of a street cat. Butch finds out that living Toms cushy life isnt what it seems when Jerry makes his life difficult and Gingers doting is humiliating. Tom finds that living off the street is tricky and difficult. They very quickly switch back to the way it was.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tuffy hires detectives Tom and Jerry to investigate the ghost hauntings in his house. At first Tom and Jerry think its just his imagination but discover that the house seems haunted. They find out its a rat who wanted to chase Tuffy out so he could live there with his family but is ok with sharing the home.

programme.title: Tom and Jerry in New York
programme.sub-title: Too Much Monkey Business/Doggie Championship/Snow Day/Toots the Terrible
programme.desc: Tom is charged with keeping a VIP chimp away from bananas at the Hotel. Tom takes Spikes place in a dog agility contest where Jerry is their secret weapon. A musical frolic in the snow on a winters day in the City. Toots is determined to catch Jerry so she and Tom can spend more time together.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol. Undeterred he manages to get a push, but for some reason the do-gooders dont want to push him all the way to the beach! Instead he uses wind power, piggy backs on a car transporter and 802harnesses up some horses to try and get to his destination.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Scrapper gives Bean fleas and Bean is forced to call in the pest control person. His flat will take 24 hours to fumigate. Bean begs Mrs. Wicket to let him stay with her. She agrees as long as Bean helps her with cooking cleaning etc. 24 hours later and Bean is desperate to see the back of her. The feeling is mutual. But then Mrs. Wicket starts itching …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is out shopping when it starts to rain. Taking refuge in a trendy coffee bar Bean is fascinated both by the brewing machinery and the amount of money people will pay for small cups of coffee! Scenting a fortune to be made Bean opens up his own strange successful coffee bar …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wakes up on a freezing cold winters morning to discover that the boiler is broken and no sign of the repairman. He tries increasingly ridiculous ways to warm up his tea his toothpaste and himself before venturing out to discover somewhere to hunker down and get warm.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Irma wants a romantic break; Bean doesnt. Its too expensive. Irma kidnaps Teddy and refuses to give him back unless Bean promises to take her to Paris. Caught between his inability to pay and his love of Teddy Bean doesnt know what to do! Until he spots a cat beauty competition in which first prize is a romantic break in Paris - if only he can catch Scrapper …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Bean wants to avoid lunch with Irmas Mum at all costs. He persuades Mrs. Wicket to let him join her on a coach trip to a concert - but he has to disguise himself as an old-aged pensioner or he wont be allowed on the coach. Once on the coach Bean drives everyone mad with his anti-boredom antics.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Bean is showing Irma his favourite tree in the park one day when he discovers a tree surgeon getting ready to cut it down. He darts up the tree and wont come back down. Irma loves this new side of Bean-ey! The tree surgeon is frustrated and tries various ploys to get Bean down. But can Bean make it to the toilet without being discovered and still save that tree?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket is persuaded by a jaunty estate agent to put her house up for sale. Bean is distraught - where will he live? Not Mrs. Wickets problem. Bean decides to hi-jack the sales process in order to deter all potential buyers - even if it means turning the whole house upside down!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is over the moon when he meets Mr. Pod because both men have so much in common; same shirt, jacket, trousers and underpants. And to top it all, Pod is Beans spitting image! Bean falls to Earth with a bump, though, when his girlfriend, Irma Gobb, finds Mr. Pod much better looking than him.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Inspired by a wildlife documentary on TV, Mr. Bean dusts off his camera and treks deep into the countryside in search of the perfect wildlife photograph. After two fruitless days of being the hunter, he is somewhat miffed to find himself the hunted.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs pursue Lamput across a vast desert. Things go wrong and all three end up stranded with no way to call for help. Stuck with each other, the trio roam the desert as days turn into years and the Docs grow old. One day, they find a map that leads to a Fountain of Youth and a way out of the desert, but can they survive the journey across the harsh, sand sea?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs finally catch Lamput! Mission accomplished…and now they have nothing to do. Every other job to catch lab experiments gone rogue is a piece of cake compared to Lamput. Realizing that theyve lost their lives purpose, Specs and Skinny decide to break Lamput out of the labs hi-tech prison so that they can go back to catching him again.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: After the Docs constantly fail to catch Lamput with the power of science and technology, they come across an unlikely source to help them with their troubles - Magic! A witch offers them a magic marker that gives them any supernatural powers they draw on their skin. Lamput must now escape and Skinny with their new magical power!

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: The kids notice Grady is sad and Barney shows them that simple acts of kindness go a long way. Barney adds a dash of magic to the kids actions that inspire others, allowing everyone to see the magnitude and power of simple acts of kindness.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and Skinny spruce themselves up and head out to a piano concerto in the royal concert hall. Theyre on their best behavior, until they spot a fellow culture vulture who also happens to be small, orange and squishy. Honestly, theyre letting all sorts of rabble into these places these days. The Docs decide that a sleeping potion might be a quick and quiet way of capturing Lamput. Naturally things get out of hand, and when the entire audience catches a whiff of the snoozy brew, we find out exactly how hard it is to stay awake during a classical music recital. One star.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: MOE wants to know what its like to be a member of the Batwheels, but the bot gets more than he bargained for when Bam invites him along for an exciting mission to stop Poison Ivy.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bam brings Catwomans Catmobile, Kitty, to life so the Batwheels can have even teams for their game of "Bat-Ball," but the Kitty "Kitty" is too wild to be contained, despite Bams best attempts to convince her to play along.

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gangs trip to be bayou is ruined by a shambling Swamp Beast thats scaring away anyone who dares to enter its soggy domain!

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang hits the ski slopes although Daphnes more focused on nailing Fred with a revenge snowball. Their snowy fun is soon interrupted by the appearance of an evil Snowman Monster eager to scare all trespassers off his mountain.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean has forgotten hes supposed to be cooking dinner for his long-suffering girlfriend Irma. He dashes to the supermarket to buy some groceries but why buy food when you can win an entire trolley full in an All You Can Eat Competition? But Mr Bean has some stiff competition - no one can eat one of Mr Maggs pies quicker than Mr Maggs himself. Mr Bean has to think fast to win. But after all that eating will Bean still be in the mood to cook a romantic meal?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is in need of a sturdy new bookcase and sets off to visit a furniture warehouse. He finds one thats perfect but is outraged when hes told he has to build the bookcase himself! Bean is unfamiliar with flat pack assembly and struggles to construct his new bookcase failing miserably when he discovers hes one screw short. Mr Bean heads back to the shop only to find its closed!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean decides to take Teddy on holiday to the seaside. But when he arrives at his hotel a spoilt little girl wants Teddy all for herself. And her protective dad only wants the best for his princess. An on-going tussle ensues between Mr Bean the little girl and her Dad resulting in a chase across the seaside town and onto the pier. No one comes between Mr Bean Teddy and their "relaxing" holiday!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is left in peace when Mrs Wicket goes off on her holidays. This means Mr Bean has free access to her daily newspaper. But every time he goes down to collect it from the letterbox it disappears. Someone is taking it but who? Mr Bean is determined to nab the mysterious newspaper stealer and uses a range of ingenious homemade traps in his quest to catch the sneaky thief.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to find a nice quiet place to read his book so he sets off for the Library. But instead of reading he becomes distracted by some funny online videos he sees on the Librarys computer. Before he knows it Mr Bean is recording his own video which is uploaded for everyone to see. Things start to go crazy when people check out his funny video and his popularity takes off. But does Mr Bean enjoy being in the public eye and how long will his celebrity last?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is obsessed by his favourite TV hero "Super Spy" and is excited when his very own Super-Spy spy kit arrives in the post. While Mr Bean is pretending to be his favourite character and delighting in all his gadgets he spots some unusual goings on in the Bruisers house next door. Naturally Mr Bean assumes the worst and sets out to rectify the situation.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: When his model aeroplane is blown out of the sky by that of a rival kid, Mr. Bean sets his sights on revenge. Next day, his newly constructed fighter plane, almost ready for take-off, sadly lacks a vital part - and the blinking model shop is shut! No matter. Its chocks away with Teddy at the controls, fighting for airspace over London N10.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: When Mr. Bean breaks his favourite Royal mug he discovers theres only one place to buy a replacement: Buckingham Palace, home of the Queen of England. When one of Her Majestys corgis runs off with his teddy, Bean gives chase through secret tunnels… and gets lost.

programme.title: Superthings Rivals of Kaboom, Kazoom Power
programme.desc: The Kazoom Kid Heroes and the Kazoom Kid Villains face off to gain control of the citys energy.

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang gets caught up in international espionage and intrigue when they cross paths with British secret agent Jenny Vex and must help her complete her dangerous mission of stopping a monstrous evil mercenary called Minus from killing the meal of breakfast - forever.

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Freds worst nightmare comes true when an evil spirit possesses the Mystery Machine and turns his beloved van into an unrelenting monster out to destroy him and the gang before they can solve the mystery.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput outsmarts the Docs by luring them onto a street basketball court and pitting them against the toughest ballerz in town. When the jocks look like utterly destroying poor old Specs and Skinny, Lamputs conscience kicks in. Our orange buddy decides to help the Docs out with some of that special brand of court magic. Fate is fickle, though - when it comes out that the Docs are using a performance-enhancing orange blob, the jocks call foul. Specs and Skinny are reminded yet again what it feels like to be dunked on.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Determined to play the piano, Mr Bean finds a tune in his heart and sausages for fingers.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Its the start of a Fun Run. Mr. Bean lines-up beside his deadly enemy: the fat bloke who stole his parking space. Fun Run or no, nothing will stop Bean beating this man to the finishing post, even if he has to flag a cab.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: A crafty cat burglar is causing alarm and concern throughout the town with a series of daring rooftop robberies. After Mrs Wickets house is burgled and Bean has his wallet stolen he decides the only way to deal with this cunning housebreaker is to don a costume and become a superhero (like the ones in his favourite comic book). But Super Bean soon finds he has his hands full helping to rescue cats stuck in trees and old ladies with their spilled shopping.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is tidying his flat and chucking out a load of old unwanted junk. Unfortunately during the big clear out Teddy accidentally falls into a bin bag which gets put out in the street. Bean is horrified when the rubbish van arrives and he realises that dear old Teddy is now on his way to the landfill. Bean races across town to the dump but how will he ever find his friend amongst all the mountains of junk?

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A frog swallows an ancestral jewel that bestows it with the power of mind control. Grizzy uses the frog to swallow the flies that have proliferated in the cabin, and which now let themselves be docilely caught. The Lemmings dont miss a thing. They decide to get hold of the frog to hypnotize an uncooperative tapir who refuses to play rodeo. Grizzy hypnotizes the Lemmings, who become his servants. But several Lemmings escaped and are preparing a rescue mission.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: A military convoy has an accident while transporting top-secret material. In the impact, a technological sphere flies out and rolls over to Grizzy, who was gathering berries in the forest. Grizzy realizes that the sphere is a sort of compass that indicates the direction of his desires. He follows it and finds a bush overflowing with his favorite berries. The Lemmings recover the compass to find super game sites in the forest.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a hand-shaped scepter ornated with a gold nugget that covers anything it touches with gold. Grizzy uses the object to "gold leaf" the Lemmings and swipe their chocolate bar. The Lemmings use their golden casts as armors to recover their chocolate. During the combat, the gold nugget is replaced by a chocolate one: the scepter now coats everything with chocolate. The Lemmings snatch it and flee.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings organize a dance contest where the first prize is a jar of chocolate spread. Grizzy is hungry and decides to participate. He partners up with a talented dancing parrot and wins. Incapable of sharing, Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over the prize. The parrot brings the jar to a temple devoted to the glory of dancing parrots. To get it back, Grizzy and the Lemmings must perform a choreography. They decide to rehearse together.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a strange creature fossilized in amber resin that resembles him. A natural science encyclopedia confirms that its his ancestor. Grizzy wants to take the block of amber, but the Lemmings fight him for it because the blue animal with big teeth is their ancestor too. The block cracks during their fight and frees the ancestor who turns out to be a rather unmanageable burden.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a strange card game representing the elements along with instructions. The idea is to pretend that the ground is on fire or of ice, like in the game "Floor is Lava." They transform the cabin into a giant adventure trail. Depending on the card drawn, they must avoid zones on the floor with flames or wax. Grizzy unceremoniously gets rids of the setup to regain control of the cabin. One of the cards lands on a stone slab that transforms into lava. The Lemmings are delighted: they will be able to play "for real"!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover a very particular cocoa tree with chocolate-spread sap! Reduced to eating canned Brussels sprouts, the only remaining food in the cabin, Grizzy is baffled when he sees the Lemmings parading past to equip themselves with all sorts of containers: ladles, soup spoons, bowls, buckets, basins, etc. He watches them through binoculars and discovers that they have planted a faucet in a tree where chocolate spread flows. Grizzy decides to siphon off their tree.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: A sneaky trick strands the Batwheels at the docks, clearing the way for a Batcave heist by the Legion of Zoom. Its up to MOE to stop the Zoomers with zany improvised tricks and traps with a little help from Ace and Batcomputer.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After snagging an ultra-fuel-cell upgrade, Penguins Ducky Boat suddenly becomes the fastest vehicle in Gotham. Confident leader Bam must rally the Batwheels to stop the turbo-Ducky!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Buff befriends Mr. Freezes snowcrawler Snowy, the other Batwheels bristle at the thought of hanging out with a "bad guy…" so Buff sets out to change their minds.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After he causes the Batwing to crash, Bam becomes obsessed with making it up to her during a high-stakes aerial mission against Penguin and his giant ducky blimp.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders build Tibs Squirrel a closet in his tree, but it wont fit all of Tibs stuff and he doesnt want to get rid of anything.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When The Looney Builders enter a sandcastle building contest, Tweety sees the competition and loses confidence in his idea.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Chef Hector hires The Looney Builders to build him a burger restaurant, but Daffy is so focused on beating his handheld game that he causes major setbacks.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: As The Looney Builders help Petunia build a greenhouse, she cant wait for the veggies to grow and does everything she can to speed up the process.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are forced to go back to Detective School in order to renew their detective licenses.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: A werewolf terrorizes Tom and the inhabitants of the Catsylvania village.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Toms obsession with the sound his new crinkle ball drives the rest of the household crazy forcing them to take drastic measures to rid the house of the annoying toy.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are hired to find a missing priceless Maltese Pigeon.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Tom enlists the help of the lake monster to terrorize the mouse village forcing Jerry Van Mouseling to intervene and save the day.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Mice visitors from Mars force Tom to change the way he treats Jerry.

programme.title: Tahtedevaheline Ella
programme.desc: Ella is enlisted to pet sit Buttons, a friends dog, on the very day she has to finish a school project about Venus. She decides to take on both responsibilities at once by taking Buttons with her to the planet to capture the final piece of video footage she needs. When the thunder from the storms around Venus scare Buttons into accidentally detaching himself from his pod, he lands on the pla net and disappears. Ella and her friends search frantically on the hot planet but cannot find him. Its Buttons who finds Ella! Ella admits she shouldnt have taken her furry friend with her, but at least she learned new facts for her project!

programme.title: Tahtedevaheline Ella
programme.desc: Slippys Dad insists he get rid of all his inventions to free up some space. Slippy cant bear to, so decides to store them on the dark side of Mercury.

programme.title: Tahtedevaheline Ella
programme.desc: On Sedna, Ella and her friends discover the space probe Voyager 1. Ella takes the Golden Record from the probe and takes it to Mom who reveals that Ellas greatest grandfather recorded a greeting on it!

programme.title: Tahtedevaheline Ella
programme.desc: Human Day is Ellas favourite day of the year and she invites Madhu to join her family for dinner. Madhu wants to make a good impression and wonders how to prepare.

programme.title: Tahtedevaheline Ella
programme.desc: While checking out a rogue planet, Ella, Slippy and Madhu crash onto its surface. When the heat from underground causes the planets icy crust to burst open, they all tumble down into the darkness and become separated.

programme.title: Toad and Friends
programme.desc: Hedge normally hibernates but this year she is determined to see Christmas. Although shes not much use in decoration preparation, she is able to bring peace and understanding to all when there is a dispute over the Christmas Tree.

programme.title: Toad and Friends
programme.desc: Tinker comes up with a cunning plan for herself and Chief to be delivered as a parcel into Toad Hall. But the journey there proves to be more much more arduous than she could possibly imagine.

programme.title: Toad and Friends
programme.desc: Chief agrees to accompany Toad on a day trip out in the car but only if he can drive. Chiefs plan is to steal the car by throwing Toad out but his erratic driving sees them perched precariously over the river bank. Can they ever be friends now?

programme.title: Toad and Friends
programme.desc: When Hedge learns to play chess, she fails to win gracefully. Soon no-one will play with her!

programme.title: Toad and Friends
programme.desc: Ratty is trying out his new snorkelling equipment but Portly mistakes Ratty underwater as a River Monster. An alarmed Hedge exaggerates the story and Toad tries to catch the River Monster on camera as all the riverbankers rush to witness this fabled creature.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean needs to see a very rare bird so he can tick off every page in his bird-spotting book. But he soon gets bored as he waits in a hide for the rare bird to appear. Instead he goes home and paints a picture of the bird cuts it out and sticks it high up a tree in the back garden. Soon he is besieged by excited twitchers who think it really is the rare bird. They are all keen to get a snap and theyre willing to pay good money for a peek.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean finds himself babysitting a baboon.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean fancies a game of golf so he creates his own golf course inside his flat and invites Irma to join him for a round. programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: With their endless battles over the rangers cabin which they do not want to share, Grizzy and the Lemmings end up blowing the cabin up. Amidst the debris, they discover a strange pack: an army tent with all the necessary equipment to recreate a "home" in nature. Its the chance to discover the joys of camping in the wild.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings encounter a white bear which has drifted all the way to them on a chunk of ice which is slowly melting. The bear makes a fabulous rodeo partner, he just needs enough ice to keep cool. Even a few ice cubes on his head are enough. The only obstacle to this beautiful friendship is Grizzy, who considers himself master of the fridge and thus of the cabins ice production.

programme.title: Superthings Rivals of Kaboom, Kazoom Power
programme.desc: The Kazoom Kids must awaken the SuperThings from a thousand-year sleep induced by Zzleeper.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: Determined to save the community garden, Barney and the kids go on a magical adventure where they become butterflies, and help a little ladybug with a big problem. They ultimately learn that doing small things can affect big change!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Buffs trusty winch is knocked out of action by Poison Ivy, he must learn to improvise and come up with creative solutions on the fly.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Snowy and Jestah team up to execute a mysterious plan involving rare freeze-berries, Batwing and Buff pair up to take on the dastardly duo, but Batwing decides to carry out the mission herself, putting both her and Buff at risk.

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and Fred is ready to solve a Christmas mystery! Unfortunately the town the gang has arrived in is being attacked by a Pterodactyl and it doesnt seem to have anything to do with Christmas!

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Daphne brings the gang to Ireland to visit an ancient Blake family castle. As the gang becomes enchanted by the magical Emerald Isle an angry rampaging Giant makes them reconsider just how wonderful all the old myths and legends really are.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Beans attempt to cut the grass is thwarted by a pesky root which refuses to budge. When Mr Bean breaks his spade he heads to the local Garden Centre to find a replacement. But instead of simply buying one he enters a gardening competition to win one - judged by none other than the Queen herself! Its gardening gloves off when Mr Bean goes into battle with his rival green-fingered competitors.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Irma are off for a day at the seaside. Irma is travelling light but Bean wants to take almost everything his owns in an enormous trunk. Arriving at the seaside Beans trunk gets accidentally swapped with a trunk belonging to a famous stage magician. As Bean entertains Irma pulling rabbits out of hats the angry magician arrives on the scene - and hes not a happy bunny.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is not allowed to fly off on holiday as his passport has no photograph. After failing to get one from a photo booth he tries numerous other ways to get his photo taken including photobombing a tourists snap. None of these work but after Bean is arrested maybe the police can assist him. Say cheese!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Beans tranquillity is shattered by deafening roadworks outside his bedroom window. Threats, sabotage and subterfuge all fail to quell the cacophony until Bean has the ingenious idea of feeding the workmen into peaceful submission. But the silence ends with a bang!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean likes nothing more than to relax on his sofa with a good meal and his favourite telly programme. Unfortunately, a painful explosion of springs under his bottom puts an end to that. He sets about buying another one… but, alas, sofas are expensive items. TV dinners may well be a thing of the past for Mr Bean.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Its a night out at the theatre for the Docs but when they spot Lamput in the front row, they decide to give up their night of culture for a night of capture! Lamput escapes backstage where he morphs from scenery into props, then into costume and eventually ends up on stage! The Docs make chase, and end up becoming part of the performance too, much to the Directors dismay. Can the show go on? Or will it be a total flop?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs spot Lamput in the audience of a magic show and try to catch him. The chase takes them backstage where Lamput evades the Docs with the help of different magic contraptions until Specs and Skinny unknowingly ends up on stage. They become reluctant assistants to the Magician who is about to perform some death-defying tricks - with the help of the Docs!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs chase Lamput into the darkest jungle, where they have a go at the literal oldest trick in the book: a covered pit trap. Why these guys think this will work is anyones guess. Meanwhile Lamputs facing a whole different challenge: a lost baby elephant is looking for her mama, and seems to have a knack for getting in all kinds of trouble along the way. Lamput and the baby elephant do eventually find the mama pachyderm - with help from the Docs. And their stupid pit trap. Yet again these guys have caught more than they bargained for.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: When it seems like Spike has developed an allergic reaction to Tom, Rick buys Ginger a hypoallergetic cat named Glory.At first it seems like shes too good to be true, but shes secretly making Spike, Tom and Jerry miserable. The three team up to get rid of Glory, but shes more cunning than she looks.

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
programme.desc: Dr. Bigby creates cookies that can give animals superpowers. Jerry and Napoleon sneak some cookies and they have fun terrorizing Tom an alley cat who has broken in to eat them. The tables are turned when Tom gets his hands on the cookies.

programme.title: Tom and Jerry in New York
programme.sub-title: The Spas the Limit / The Hairy Dignitary / Year of the Mouse / Relativity
programme.desc: Tom and Spike get treated to a trip to the Hotel spa; Tom trades places with a diplomats cat; A musical visit to Chinatown; Jerrys jolly Bavarian cousins visit the Hotel.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Whilst browsing the supermarket for lovely grub, Mr. Beans life-long pal, Teddy, is kidnapped. Bean tracks down the nasty men responsible and finds that Teddy is not their only captive. Mr. Bean rescues a hundred teddy bears once their ears are put through an industrial sewing machine.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean drives his favourite Teddy to the cinema to see his favourite movie - Titanic. Now he simply has to park the car. But when youre Mr Bean, nothings simple. His ingenious efforts to find a parking space are persistently foiled. And the clock is ticking....

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean wants to learn skateboarding but hurts himself on his first try. Meanwhile Miss Wince is showing off her new mobility scooter at Mrs. Wickets. Bean is entranced. He could do wicked "ollies" with that! He absconds with a souped-up scooter and heads straight to the skate park ready to challenge Bruiser Senior and Junior …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket becomes annoyingly inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing - calling for him at all hours of the day and night. Bean cant get any sleep! He decides that the only way to restore peace in the household is to go out and find Scrapper himself - a journey that takes him deep into Londons sewers …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Bean discovers Mrs. Wickets nephew and Bruiser Jnr swapping football stickers and decides that he wants to fill up a sticker album too. He buys-up all the stickers in the neighbourhood and has almost completed his task when Nephew points out that hes missing one: the famous sticker owned by local footballing celebrity Jamie Studds. Bean turns thief to be the best collector of em all.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean thinks hes just dug up a valuable coin in the back-garden and goes rushing off to the Museum to have it valued little knowing that its actually Bruiser Snrs much-loved but valueless fake gold medallion. Bruiser Snr wants it back; and forces Bean to break back into the Museum to get it.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Bean discovers Declan giving Irma a lift in his swanky new SUV. Bean is unimpressed until Declan shows off all the cars features. Undeterred Bean professes his car superior. Declan issues a challenge - to see which car Irma will choose for her lift back to work. Bean decides his car may need a little "pimping" …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mrs. Wickets Nephew is staying with her when he wins two tickets to an Outward Bound course. She refuses to go but then ropes in Bean to look after the child. The two start a competition to see who will win the trophy. Bean is a relentless competitor winning everything up until the point things start getting out of hand …

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy have no plans, so decide to stay in bed all day. Mr Bean is determined that his feet cant touch the ground, so he pushes the bed around with a broom. He has to find ingenious ways to make his tea and toast for breakfast, brush his teeth and an even bigger challenge of ordering a pizza and collecting it from downstairs without getting out of bed!

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: After seeing the flashy electric go-kart Mr Paliwal has bought for his daughter Divya, Mr Bean and Billy build their own using items around Mrs Wickets garden. At the go-kart track, Mr Bean and Mr Paliwal are unimpressed with Billy and Divyas driving skills so take the karts for a "proper" race around the park. Meanwhile Mrs Wicket is on the warpath when she finds things missing from her house.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput takes refuge in a fancy hotel. Specs and Skinny bluff their way past the doorman by acting like they come from the expensive side of the tracks. Spoiler: they dont. The honeymoon suite is like nothing theyve ever seen; the Docs sheen of respectability quickly evaporates when theres robes to wear and beds to jump on. Their taste of the good life doesnt last long, though; another Lamput chase results in a proper trashed hotel room, just like you read about. Then downstairs for some à la carte chaos in the hotel restaurant. Its bad news for the Docs when the tab comes due; a Lab wage wont cover these extras.

programme.title: Barneys World
programme.desc: The kids are making a quilt for Barneys birthday featuring their favorite things to do with Barney. David has a hard time choosing just one thing, so Baby Bop and Billy help him decide just in time for the party.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs prove their inventing skills by coming up with an age-altering time-ray. This breakthrough could change the world. If they used it for something other than chasing Lamput. Obsessed much, fellas? Wildly shooting their time-ray off in public causes a not-unsurprising amount of chaos, until the local law enforcement gets caught in the cross-fire. Looks like the Specs and Skinny are gonna be in jail till they get old the normal way.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Everyone assumes that Harley Quinn is the culprit in a recent burglary. But as Batman and Bam pursue Harley, Bibi and Redbird begin to suspect that she may actually be innocent.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Buff trains with Batwing to improve his gracefulness and uses her lessons on a delicate mission against the Riddler.

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and Fred is ready to solve a Christmas mystery! Unfortunately the town the gang has arrived in is being attacked by a Pterodactyl and it doesnt seem to have anything to do with Christmas!

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Daphne brings the gang to Ireland to visit an ancient Blake family castle. As the gang becomes enchanted by the magical Emerald Isle an angry rampaging Giant makes them reconsider just how wonderful all the old myths and legends really are.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean inadvertently causes an accident which prevents Irma taking the scout troop to Big Bears Scout Camp. With the scout master and mini bus out of action Mr Bean steps in to save the day. As temporary scoutmaster Mr Bean enjoys his new role but his obsessive badge collecting wins him no friends within the group.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean cannot find anywhere to park other than the space he spots in a schools car park. Theres a case of mistaken identity and Mr Bean finds himself teaching a class of unruly school kids. Bean uses every trick in the book to win them over and ends up teaching the headmaster how to be a success in school.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is in the library studying his family heritage. Someone brings to his attention Mr Beans resemblance to a certain Lord Bean. Mr Bean sets off to track down his ancestral home (a castle) in Scotland where he is welcomed with open arms. But owning a castle is not cheap. Can Mr Bean escape before he runs out of money and has there been a case of mistaken identity?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean and his beloved car find themselves in a crash for crash battle with his arch nemesis the Reliant Robin. Its a contest to find out who can hold their nerve the longest. Does Mr Bean win? Is his car left unscathed? And more importantly do we find out who the driver of the Reliant Robin really is?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean has got everything ready for Irmas birthday; card cake candles but he just needs to get her some flowers. But nothing goes to plan as Mr Bean inadvertently causes a car crash involving a bride on her wedding day. Theres no time to lose as Mr Bean promises hell get the bride to the church on time. Irma is not a happy lady as Mr Bean is distracted by the task in hand.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean is keen to own a brand new smart phone when he discovers all the wonderful things it can do. But after a trip to the mobile phone shop he is horrified at how much they cost and decides to build his own one. Beans phone may be bulky but it comes with a whole range of built in gadgets especially useful during a race to The Tower of London.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: When did Mr. Bean first meet his teddy bear? Did he really learn to drive his mini at the age of ten? Could he possibly have known his battle-axe of a landlady when she was a sweet and blushing bride? Bean takes us on a journey into the past, answering these questions and giving us an inkling as to what made him the man he is today.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean finds himself lumbered with an unwanted pet in the form of a four-legged ball of pink fur with piggy eyes and a penchant for earthworms. Encyclopedias leave him none the wiser as to the identity of the pesky creature but Bean cant bring himself to just abandon it. The puzzle is eventually solved after a picnic in the park and a raid on the local pet shop.

programme.title: Superthings Rivals of Kaboom, Kazoom Power
programme.desc: Kid Kazoom and Multy have to enter an active volcano to retrieve a new Kazoom fragment.

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Daphne brings the gang to a fancy Ice Hotel co-owned by her family where a new exhibit of ice age artifacts is opening. Things heat up, however, when a frozen Ice Man thaws out and goes on a rampage inside the hotel. Solving the mystery becomes even more complicated when the gang realizes Daphne may just have ulterior motives for going to the hotel to begin with.

programme.title: Ole ikka lahe, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang heads to Shaggys beloved grandmothers Florida retirement home, where they learn a crazed Ape Man has been frightening the elderly residents. In order to lessen Shaggys worry that he doesnt give his Grammy enough bragging rights, the gang pretends Shaggy is their leader and Daphne, his adoring girlfriend, inadvertently putting more pressure on Shaggy to solve the mystery of the Ape Man - who, as it turns out, is less horrifying than the shorts Fred decided to wear to beat the Florida heat.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: ""Chasing Lamput" turns out to be the ultimate backstage pass; the Docs pursue the orange blob through the dressing room and directly onto the stage of a gigantic stadium rock concert. The crowd goes wild. Which raises questions about their taste in music, to be honest; Skinny plays guitar like hes gotten himself tangled in the strings (which he has), and Specs drumming, well, its certainly got passion. No taste, skill or rhythm, but certainly passion. The stage ends up in tatters by the time the actual band arrives. Those Docs are a hard act to follow.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean gets in a flap when a monster turns up in his cake-mix. The good news, though, is that the monster turns out to be a harmless baby bird. The bad news is that it grows into a huge stork and takes over his home. Bean attempts to return it to the wild, and finds teaching it to fly makes his arms ache.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: When the frogspawn in Mr. Beans bath hatch out, its the last thing his landlady needs, especially when shes invited the Mayor for tea. Hundreds of angry amphibians decide to invite themselves as well. Bean proves to be no expert at catching slippery green things that wont stop hopping about all over the blinking place.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys a robot to clean his flat, but it ends up trashing half the town.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean wants an ice cream from the ice cream van. But by the time he gets to the front of the queue the ice-cream man has gone to lunch. Bean takes it upon himself to climb through in an open window and into the back of the van from where he starts to help himself. Unfortunately he soon attracts a crowd and is forced to serve a long queue of kids until all the ice cream runs out. When the ice-cream man comes back from lunch and drives away he is unaware that Bean is still hiding in the back of his van en route to the ice cream factory.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy expels the Lemmings from the cabin where they had built a cumbersome obstacle course. Peaceful at last and feeling lazy, he is determined not to leave his couch. The Lemmings discover a magic Mayan disc that allows you to choose instantaneous mutations of other animals features: bat wings, reindeer antlers, elephant trunks, etc. The mutant Lemmings return to the cabin, determined to continue playing their game while enjoying their new accessories.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: As they fight over the last jar of chocolate spread, Grizzy and the Lemmings accidentally send it flying deep into the jungle. They both set out in search for the jar, but in a forest that dense, its an impossible mission. In a Mayan Temple, the Lemmings discover a magic bracelet that increases ones sense of smell tenfold and use it to find the jar. Grizzy loses their trail, but finds some Mayan bracelets himself: one for eyesight and one for hearing. Enough to infallibly track down the Lemmings!

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Just as Grizzy is about to go to bed, he ousts the Lemmings who are holding a surprise party in the cabin. The Lemmings land in a Mayan Temple devoted to the moon. While toying with an ancestral console, the Lemmings set off a cosmic phenomenon that brings the moon, which is now the size of a disco ball, to the temple. In its aura, gravity becomes very weak. Enough to get rid of Grizzy and have a very original fiesta.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy does his best to get rid of the Lemmings and enjoy some peace and quiet in the cabin, but each time they come back with a new and even more-disturbing activity. When he sees some penguins marching in a perfectly disciplined line, Grizzy decides to teach the Lemmings how to behave in his presence. He locks himself up with them inside the garage, which has been transformed into an elementary school classroom. Grizzy is determined to make discipline reign but he has forgotten about the Lemmings natural penchant for bedlam.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight once again and cause an accident with Santa Claus sled. The Lemmings rush to the crash site and get their hands on Santas magic bag. While Grizzy is tidying up the cabin after their fight, he is baffled to see the Lemmings come back him, quiet and calm. The rodents break out into Christmas carols and prepare a delicious snack for Grizzy before slipping out again. Suspicious, Grizzy follows them and discovers that the bag rewards persons whose wishes are equal to their goodwill.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings do not agree on which program to watch on TV. Grizzy confiscates the remote-control device. He thinks hes won the battle, but the Lemmings find another one at the research station. A furious combat begins until the adversaries realize that the research station device has a special button that controls objects.

programme.title: Grizzy ja lemmingud
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a blast racing down the ice slope in competition with the stuffed Bear-Ranger and manage to win each time. Grizzy cannot stand seeing his avatar humiliated and he decides to enter the competition to help him. Their frenzied descent gets out of hand and everyone is propelled all the way to the hangar of the research station, where they discover an ultra-sophisticated racing game. The racecourse sprawls over the entire icefield via drones that project holographic elements. Grizzy and the Lemmings get into super-fast snowmobiles and launch into the race of the century.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Everyone is ecstatic when Bibi, Batgirl, and Robin capture Toyman and his Do-Over remote - except for Bibi, who failed to stick the landing on a big jump. Unwilling to accept her failure, Bibi uses Toymans Do-Over remote until she perfects her jump!

programme.desc: Feeling neglected after being passed over on missions, Bam asks MOE to install experimental upgrades to curry Batmans favor. But, when Bams new powers are stronger than he can control, Batman - and the mission - are suddenly in danger!

programme.title: Tom ja Jerry
